did.unittitle: Dr. Harry M. Spodak Flatbush photograph collection
did.abstract: Three photographs, dated circa 1890 to 1899. The photographs show Flatbush Avenue, the Flatbush Dutch Reformed Church, and Erasmus Hall High School, all located in the Flatbush neighborhood of Brooklyn. The image of Flatbush Avenue was taken by F.A. Lippold; no other photographers are identified.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Three photographs, dated circa 1890 to 1899. The photographs show Flatbush Avenue, the Flatbush Dutch Reformed Church, and Erasmus Hall High School, all located in the Flatbush neighborhood of Brooklyn. The image of Flatbush Avenue was taken by F.A. Lippold; no other photographers are identified.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: The Brooklyn Historical Society holds several manuscript and photography collections related to Erasmus Hall High School and the Flatbush Dutch Reformed Church. Consult with library staff for more information.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Dr. Harry M. Spodak, 1984.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Based on the date range of this collection, all items in the collection will enter the public domain by 2019. For information on securing rights to publish or reproduce, please see the Brooklyn Historical Society Reproduction Rights Policy.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: Item-level description and digital versions of images from the collection are available for searching via the image database in the library.
